file_content.text: You have returned... and added the extra verses that only you could add.
I'm back, as promised.
These objects... reacted to me. Did you know they would do that?
You knew these things would react to me, didn't you? I expect an explanation.
You knew these would react to me and didn't tell me? I demand an explanation.
Yuun apologizes for any misunderstandings. There is an odd maelstrom swirling about you....
Yuun suspected, therefore, that only you could walk the path to claim them.
Yuun apologizes that the exact nature of the link and its larger significance cannot be explained more fully. Yuun lacks the words.
Everything is ready, save for these pieces. Completing the task will take but a moment.
The instrument is complete, and you yourself tuned it earlier.
With sufficient expansion, this device can hide your new base of operations from the long range sensors of the Eternal Fleet.
That's incredible, Yuun. Thank you.
Yuun is humbled by your thanks. In truth, Yuun only found the path--it is you who walked the most critical steps.
You always did manage to work miracles. This will be a huge help to the Alliance.
Are you saying this will keep Arcann's ships from ever finding us?
Now that this device is complete, Yuun shall gladly join you. In truth, Yuun had already seen this joint path approaching.
Yuun shall make all haste in traveling to Odessen. May our new path lead us to wisdom and justice.
You're making a pretty bold claim. This thing had better work like you say.
There is no call for doubt. It is your own special nature which has guaranteed the device's harmony.
Yuun eagerly awaits your return, and thanks you again for your help.
You return quickly, as Yuun had hoped. Is it now a more convenient time to assist Yuun?
Yes, let's get to work.
I'm still not doing this.
[Wait for his reaction]
This is not good....
[Yuun urgently checks his breathing equipment]
Hey there, Yuun! It's been a while.
Yuun's breather is not malfunctioning... you are not a hallucination of atmosphere poisoning....
That's some way to greet an old friend....
I'll admit that I've never understood your creepy Findsman stuff, but that's just rude.
Major! Yuun apologizes greatly, no offense was intended.
Hallucination is a common side effect of atmosphere poisoning in Gand. Yuun feared a breather failure....
Hey there, Yuun! It's been a while.
Sir... You... the signs indicated a meeting of great import today but....
Howdy, Bugface. How's the creepy Findsman stuff going?
Sir... You... Apparently not as well as Yuun had thought.
Over a year we searched for you... but no path or trace could be seen. All believed you had not survived the battle.
To find that you are alive shames this Gand as a Findsman, but also instills great joy.
It's good to see you too, Yuun.
Yuun is happy to hear the feeling is mutual. Still, there must be a greater reason for your visit. You have always acted with purpose, sir.
Guess you can't find everything after all.
The Findsman's path is not a journey to perfection, but understanding. Yuun understands that you have always acted with great purpose, sir--why have you come?
I'm getting the old squad back together, Yuun... and then some. I came here to recruit you.
Pack your gear, soldier! We're moving out.
Yuun no longer serves in the Republic military, though it is an honor to be sought out regardless. However, the path of Zakuul must be followed to its end before Yuun departs.
Yuun is gathering parts to assemble a new whole. A poem of technology. Yuun has gathered most of the seventeen pieces already....
If this Gand could humbly impose, your assistance in gathering the remaining parts is required before starting down this new path together.
Always happy to help.
Fine, I'll help. Whatever gets us out of here the quickest.
Yuun greatly appreciates your patience and help, and provides the locations of the remaining stanzas of the poem.
Do it yourself. I've got better things to do than run errands for you.
Yuun understands, but this is the path Yuun has seen. Without your assistance, the journey cannot begin.
I said I'm not doing this.
Yuun understands; you must walk your own path. Yuun will await your return at a more convenient time.
Greetings.
I take it you're Yuun?
Correct, this Gand is named Yuun.
You, Gand. What is your name?
Greetings. This Gand is named Yuun.
You must be the one Yuun has been expecting.
I represent an Alliance opposing the Eternal Throne. I'm here to convince you to join us.
And thus the signs are made clear. Excellent. Yuun is almost ready to depart.
...Well that was easier than expected.
Pack your things, you're coming with me.
Interesting. You are quite different from how Yuun imagined you would be....
[Let Yuun Continue]
Wait... you knew I was coming?
"Knew" is not the correct word. "Felt" is more accurate.
Yuun has seen the signs of this coming meeting, and thus has been preparing.
Preparing for what?
To join and stand alongside the others who oppose the Eternal Throne.
Great. Let's get going then.
So you didn't know I was coming, or why I was coming, yet you're already prepared for it....
Yuun is preparing, not prepared. This Gand apologizes for causing misunderstanding.
The Eternal Empire's technology is a unique new form, and resisting first requires understanding.
We each have our own paths to find.
It is hard to describe, yet somehow in tune with the remaining objects.
Seeing the path and seeing its destination are not always one and the same.
This device can resonate in perfect harmony with Eternal Empire technology. Thus, it can also resonate in perfect counter to it, each tone negating the other.
You're definitely right about that.
Skip the philosophy. Are we ready to get to work or not?
Don't leave me in the dark again. Ever. Understand?
This Gand apologizes further. Full understanding will be cultivated in the future.
At long distances, yes. But it is not a cloaking device. At sufficiently close range, enemy ships may still detect the base. Caution is advisable.
